CatDescriptText: Mr. Will Rowland, 36 Perry Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?" Answer reads: "We don't do it, but we should. We would get more results, like jobs and so forth, if we did."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Will Rowland wearing pants with striped belt and light colored polo shirt with striped placket, standing on sidewalk near shoe store and record shop
